item.title: Basic Linux Commands
item.author: 作者
item.description: 1. du – display disk usage statistics 1 2 du -d 1 -h Documents # -d:depth -h:"human-readable" du -d 0 -h Documents 2. grep – file pattern searcher grep stands for “global regular expression print”. It searches files for lines that match a pattern and returns the results. It is case sensitive. 1 2 3 4 grep "Apple"
